content.p: My name is Martijn Vermaat and you're looking at my personal homepage at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.

Currently, I'm a third year's student Computer Science where my main interests are theoretical computer science and software technology. Some additional personal information can be extracted from the Q&A section below.
What you can find on this website is the following:

dl.dd: Britney is a simple interpreter for pure untyped Lambda Calculus, written in Java.

dt.a: Towers of Hanoi in Lambda Calculus

dl.dd: A solution of the Towers of Hanoi problem in Lambda Calculus.
Short explanation on how to extract information from your local Winamp CDDB database.
All things related to my study.
Some links you might think interresting.

content.p: More info about this website, including the source code, can be found on the colofon page.

dl.dt: Q: Are the colors on this webpage stolen?
dl.dd: A: Yes, they are. From the Ubuntu Linux distribution.
A: That must be Tandoori Chicken.
dl.dt: Q: What's you favourite paradox that came as quite an unpleasant surprise to Frege when he was just about to bring the second volume of his Grundlagen der Arithmetik to the presses?
Q: Why does this website suck so much?
dl.dd: A: Use a decent browser. This website will still suck but your online life will not.
dl.dt: Q: Thank you for your time.
